subject: Re: [junit] Hi I am getting failure test case even though i have correct exp and act  value
msgSnippet: ... Funny. I made the exact same mistake about a week ago. I laughed at myself for a good 3 minutes. -- J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger :: http://www.jbrains.info Your
messageBody:
Subramanian Thiruppathi wrote:
> Hi Friends,
>
> Thanks for your immediate response..
>
> Act, I done one mistake in my code..
>
> List list1 = new ArrayList();
>
> List list2 = new ArrayList();
>
> List finalList = new ArrayList();
>
> // act i want append the list1 data to finalList as collection not
> as object same //case for list2
>
> // the problem happen from here only ..
> finalList.add(list1);
> finalList.add(list2);
>
> // In the finalList content should not be list of list according my
> requirement ..
>
> // so I changed in the following way ,,so it will append the data to
> finalList
> finalList.addAll(list1);
> finalList.addAll(list2);
>
> // when are u using sop(finalList) for both the case output could be
> same ..
>
> Once gain thx u guys....
>
> Have a good day and Have nice weekend

Funny. I made the exact same mistake about a week ago. I laughed at
myself for a good 3 minutes.
--
